comments.body:
Is there a reason for not including pip check here?
```suggestion
    - rayoptics
  commands:
    - pip check
  requires:
    - pip
```

I think by removing pip check, I removed the symptom of a problem, but not the problem. With pip check, it flags a dependency of qdarkstyle, helpdev, as missing. This package is on pipy and hosted in GitLab but not on conda-forge or in anaconda.
I presume the correct solution would be for me to set up helpdev as a conda-forge submission. If there's another approach, please let me know.
Thank you for your help.

OK, I'm stuck now. I tried including helpdev and there's a message about conda-verify failing that I think prevents the build from completing. I tried reproducing on my local machine and conda-verify seems happy.
I admit I'm a little mystified that qdarkstyle is available on conda-forge but appears to depend on helpdev which isn't on conda-forge.

I've examined the use of helpdev by the qdarkstyle package. It is only used if you run the qdarkstyle package as a script to document the state of your environment, e.g. for a bug report. It is not used if you are using qdarkstyle programmically with pyqt, as is done with rayoptics (and probably all other packages depending on qdarkstyle).
I am going to remove the pip check test and helpdev from this PR.

Indeed, this is a bug in the `qdarkstyle` recipe. I've made a PR to fix it and the "pip check" test can be re-added after https://github.com/conda-forge/qdarkstyle-feedstock/pull/14 is merged.

That said, there is no reason for it to hold up this PR so LGTM üëç
